Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Lyle?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I've got the orbital data and SV clock corrections for each satellite that gets the signal. That'll make my reading as solid as the Precise Positioning Service that only the D.O.D. can use. We're talkin' 100 meter horizontal accuracy, 156 meter vertical accuracy, .340 nanoseconds time accuracy.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Why can't he talk like a person?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: ...Because he's not.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I do need one more thing, Charlie.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What's that?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Someone to turn the goddamn homing device on. No signal, no score.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: (to Steve) Where're the Italians?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Patience.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: What's that shit?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: A book. It's called reading. You should try it some time.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: You wanna read something. Read between the lines.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Well here's something even you can relate to. Albert got a lotta trim. That genius thing is a babe magnet.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Lemme see that book.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Hello?

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: Hi, sweetie.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Daddy. How are you?

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: I'm sending you something.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Really? Does it smell nice?

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: No. But it's sparkly.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Does it come with a receipt?

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: I'm having it sent to you from the store.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: (toweling her hair) Why not bring it by yourself? We could have dinner.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: Be a long trip. I'm in Genoa.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Let me guess. Checking out the birthplace of Christopher Columbus.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: Something like that.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: With your parole officer's approval.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: I think I've paid my P.O. my last visit. I liked the guy, but we never really connected.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: What are you into, Dad? Don't break my heart. You told me you were through.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: After this, I swear to you, I am.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You promised me. Daddy, don't do this.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: Everything's going to be fine. I've got to go now. I love you. Bye.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: Italians?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Not yet.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Don't worry, they'll come through. You can trust these guys.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: I trust everyone. It's the devil inside them that I don't trust. (then, to Charlie) Got a sec?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: My office.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: How you feeling, boss?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Fine. I'm fine, fine.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: You know what fine, stands for, don't you? Fucked-up, Insecure, Neurotic, and Emotional.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You've become quite the philosopher since you quit drinking.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: You don't like me sober?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: No, I'm glad. Makes you a better thief.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: For after the haul.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Hope I get to fire it up. If Steve's Italians are a no-show, it's three months prep down the shitter and I've dragged you out of retirement for nothing.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: This is kinda nice. You being the boss with all the worries, me just along for the ride.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Ain't you sweet...

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Charlie!

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Your Italians.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Yup. Dixie cups.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Dixie cups?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: I toss 'em away if there's a problem down the road.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: For those about to rock, we salute you.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Yeah.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Let's get rich.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Can you chill out back there? You'd make a hummingbird nervous.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: I'm done. Over.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Copy that. Enjoy the ride, cowboy.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Get ready. 3. 2. 1. Drop.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Sweet Jesus.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: "That for which all virtue is sold. And almost every vice -- gold."

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: My name is John and I'm a very rich alcoholic. And I'm going to live my life one very rich day at a time.

Speaker: THE CREW
Content: Alright, John!

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: You planned this one down to a t, kid. It's a gift. You saw the big picture, made contingencies, covered the angles...

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: Shit, you made thirty million dollars in gold drop out of sight without holding a gun. Who else could've pulled that off?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You could've. I had big shoes to fill.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: Fill the shoes but don't follow the footprints.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What're you talking about? You've lived the life.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: My life's been nothing but fake IDs, fake business cards and divorce papers. This is the only thing that's real.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Stella's a beautiful girl.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: She's amazing. And I spent half her childhood in prison. This is a once in a lifetime haul, Charlie. Bring down the curtain after this one. Make a new life. Find someone amazing and be there for her.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Shit.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Anyone acts stupid and his brains go on the windshield.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What the hell do you think you're doing?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Sorry Charlie. But I want the box of Cracker Jack all to myself.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You're not thinking this through. It's a stupid move.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Think so? Well you're the brilliant one. The Master Planner. Isn't that so, John?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: You bet on the wrong horse.

Speaker: JOHN BRIDGER
Content: We'll hunt you down. You're gonna regret this.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: No regrets, Dixie cup.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: If you would have told me that I would spend the next three years searching for Steve Bandell, I would have said that was nothing. Cause I would have spent a lifetime looking for that bastard if I had to.

Speaker: FIRST COP
Content: You always work in the dark?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Buzz of the fluorescents throws me off. She's all yours.

Speaker: SECOND COP
Content: Damn. Chris Perley couldn't crack it. Neither could Michael Hoyt.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Now you know who to call first.

Speaker: FIRST COP
Content: You're expensive, Stella. Those guys cut us a break on subpoena jobs. Goodwill, community service...

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Well I do it for the money. I'll send you the bill.

Speaker: SECOND COP
Content: Don't you want to see what's inside?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I never look. Bye, guys.

Speaker: RECEPTIONIST
Content: How long?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Four minutes, forty-three seconds.

Speaker: RECEPTIONIST
Content: You're the man.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: So what's on the line-up?

Speaker: RECEPTIONIST
Content: 2:00. Home safe in Fairmount Park. Owner died and the wife never knew the combination. And Todd Milliken called. He has a prototype combination lock he wants you to test out tomorrow morning. Says he added two false contact points on the tumbler.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Tell him if I don't have it opened in six minutes flat, breakfast is on me.

Speaker: RECEPTIONIST
Content: And there's a Charlie Croker in your office. He said you two know each other. (an aside) And he looks pretty fine for a white boy.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Charlie Croker.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Hi, Stella.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Refresh my memory. After you came to see me and told me what happened to my father, I told you I never wanted to see you again, didn't I?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Yeah. You did.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: So I'm a little confused.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I found him.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I can tell you where he is.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I don't want to know.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Are you sure?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: He's in Los Angeles.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: The gold bricks he stole from us were minted in Singapore and decorated with the face of a Balinese girl. I've had my tentacles out and got a call from a friend of mine and your father's, Philly Steak.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: When I was little he would play poker at the house and drop quarters under the table for me to find.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: He got word from an L.A. connection named Skinny Pete that a gold dealer has been buying bricks with the Balinese girl on them, three or four at a time.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You ever heard the expression, cut to the chase?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I tracked Steve down to an address in the Hollywood Hills. He's changed his last name to Frezelli. And get this: he had a Worthington 1000 installed in the house before he even moved in. We both know that you don't install a Worthington 1000 unless you have something precious to guard.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Precious or not, I don't deal with ill-gotten goods.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: We boosted that gold from a terrorist group that was about to trade it for bio-weapons. Now that doesn't exactly make us Robin Hood, but maybe in our own little way we were doing a good deed. Problem is, no one in my crew can handle that safe. And I need someone I can trust.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: And you think that's me? Haven't you heard that I work for the other side?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What I heard is that you have your father's touch. And he was the only safecracker I knew who could open a Worthington 1000.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I'm not a safecracker. I'm a professional safe and vault technician.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You're John Bridger's daughter. And this is our chance to set things right.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Our chance? Who do you think you are coming in here? Stealing the gold isn't going to bring my father back to life.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: No, it won't.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Then get out.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: How'd it go with the chick?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I'm working on it.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: I don't want her on the crew, Charlie.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Gotta have her. Important piece of the puzzle.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: There has to be someone else. What about Bill Huchins?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Doing ten long at Levinworth.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Red O'Reilly?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Chemo.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Martin Hernandez?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Found Jesus.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: I don't want a civilian to screw this up.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: She has the skill. And the motivation.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Exactly. She's emotional. You know what happens when emotion gets into it.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: It's emotional for all of us at this point. Don't kid yourself.

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: It's all in my patented sideways glance. Like this...

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: I hit each woman on the jury with one of these. We make contact. And I know exactly what they're doing. Undressing me with their eyes.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I see...

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: The case is all but won. That's why in jury selection I choose as many women as possible. Except lesbians, of course. I can tell in sixty seconds if they're a lesbian. Want to know how I know?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: If they don't undress you with their eyes?

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: Precisely. Like that waitress right there. See? She's looking at me right below my belt. Definitely not a lesbian.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Your fly.

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: I am fly. And I'm da bomb. Just wait until later tonight.

Speaker: BUSBOY
Content: Oh, man. I'm sorry.

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: You should be. Moron. What the hell's wrong with you?

Speaker: BUSBOY
Content: It was an accident. I'm very sorry.

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: Where's the manager? Richard Worth is not paying to have his suit cleaned. Damn. (to Stella) I'm going to... I don't believe this.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I think your date's going pretty well, what do you think?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: What are you doing here?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What do you mean? I come here all the time.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I don't think so.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Sure. Lawyers, Judges, my kind of crowd. See that gentleman there, he sentenced me to 90 days in county once. We need to talk.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: No, you need to listen. I want you to leave. Got it?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Hey, I paid valet parking prices to get in here, not to mention a twenty spot to the busboy to spill that drink on Mister Zipper.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You -- I don't believe this. You paid someone to spill that drink?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Actually, you paid for it.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Didn't notice it was me who bumped into you earlier, did you? Anyway, I was hoping we could get to know each other a little better before we leave for Los Angeles. I already booked your flight.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You truly are a fatuous, odious man.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I have no idea what you just said, but I like the sound of it.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Well maybe you'll understand this. Hit the road, Jack --

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Charlie --

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Or you'll be sorry, Charlie, cause I'll kick you in the nuts so hard that your voice will be as high as my heels.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I'm beginning to worry about this whole relationship.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I'll let you in on a secret. You can't have a relationship with a pickpocket, gold robber, or any kind of thief.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: John wasn't just a man I crewed up with, he was my friend, he was the closest thing to a father I ever had. I wish to God I could bring him back. But all I can do is go after this guy, the guy that killed him, and hit him where he lives.

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: Everything alright, Stella?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Fine. Richard. Charlie. Charlie was just saying goodbye.

Speaker: RICHARD
Content: Can I help you with something?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Oh, sorry. I was just undressing you with my eyes.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Hello.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I'm in this for one thing, Charlie, and one thing only. I want to see the look on his face when his gold is gone. He took my father from me, I'm taking this; it's the best I can do.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I see Drive Defensively is your motto.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Don't worry. Jack Daniels never let me down.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: By the way you drive, I'm not surprised you named your car after a bottle of whiskey. Left.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Jack Daniels was chief engineer of the Mini. And I drive it exactly the way it was meant to be driven.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Another left.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: We're going in circles. Who's tailing you this week?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: The possibilities are endless.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Where are they?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: We're a little early. I didn't expect us to get here quite that fast. There...

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: That's Lyle. Gearhead. He's who really invented Napster...

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: At least that's how Lyle tells it.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Half-Ear. Explosives. He lost fifty percent of his hearing in the fifth grade.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: One M-80 in the toilet bowl too many.

Speaker: KID
Content: That was rad!

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Wha'?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Handsome Rob. Premier wheel man. He once drove all the way to L.A. just so he could set the record for longest freeway chase.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Smashed the mark by twelve minutes.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: He got a hundred and ten love letters sent to his jail cell from women who saw him on TV.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: And what about you?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I've been a thief since I had baby teeth.

Speaker: BULLY
Content: Cough it up, Charlie!

Speaker: CLASSMATE
Content: So much for lunch.

Speaker: SEVEN YEAR OLD CHARLIE
Content: You need a dollar?

Speaker: CLASSMATE
Content: I thought he took your last one.

Speaker: SEVEN YEAR OLD CHARLIE
Content: He did.

Speaker: SEVEN YEAR OLD CHARLIE
Content: But I got lots more now.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: This is Stella. She's working with us on this one. IDs?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: (reading his) Melvin Lisp? Could I -- just once -- have a cool name?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: (also complaining) 220 pounds? Try 180.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Try 'Deal A Meal'.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I don't even have a cool nickname.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Enough of this sewing-circle shit. Phones.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Philly Steak says these are clean as a whistle. He also got us four dozen internal chips with different numbers. Change out the chips twice a day.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: We travel to L.A. separately.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: You still haven't told us the most important thing. What exactly is the job, Charlie? And who exactly is she?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: This is Stella Bridger. And we're finishing the job that we started in Italy.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Holy shit. It's about time.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: We need an in to get a video blueprint of the interior. We're not going into this place blind. Half-Ear, you take the first surveillance shift. Who goes in, who goes out, levels of security, you know the drill.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: You got it.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I also want audio surveillance on his phone.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I'll hack into the phone company's central office remote observance monitoring system and fool it into thinking there's a legal tap on the line. Reroute the digital copies of his calls to our own listening post.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: How long?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I'll burn through the night, have it up and running before morning.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: (to Handsome Rob) We need to know how long to get from the house to Union Station downtown.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: No problemo.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Stella. How much time will you need with the safe?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I'll have it open in five minutes flat.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: It's not the same as opening a safe for the cops. Your heart will be pounding in your ears. Perspiration on your fingertips. It's a whole different ball game.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You get me to the safe, I'll open it.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: (into recorder) We've got an anti-scaling fence. Hardened, electroplated steel. Hacksaw won't work. We'll need Nitramon.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Armed guard. 9MM semi-automatic in the holster. Security booth is accessible and ideal for a triple charger chemical grenade.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Shit. Dogs. Why do black men hate dogs? I'll tell you why, Charlie. Because dogs are racist. That's a natural fact. Someone else deal with 'em.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: (into micro cassette player) Advent Home Navigator Hybrid System. Monitors 132 points for intrusion, fire, and environmental hazards. Best way around it is to get a back door password, trip the alarm during the heist, then call it in as a false alarm.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: (into micro cassette recorder) 15:25. There he is. He's gained 15 to 20 pounds living off our money. And Handsome Rob, you're going to be pissed when you see his wheels.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: (into micro cassette recorder) Housekeeper leaves at 17:30.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: You're right on time.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: All those poor bastards out there putting their life savings in banks and S&Ls and mutual funds. What do they think -- that when the collapse comes they can depend on the government? I don't think so.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Is the camera off?

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Of course. Just like you said. I never tape you, you can see for yourself.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Governments are nothing more than puppets on the strings of the Trilateral Commission with their twisted gods.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: I mean, it's so obvious that in a world where NAFTA can overturn the Supreme Court, not to mention Microsoft's nefarious financial machinations, this, is our only refuge; gold.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Plus a little walking around money.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Where's a grenade launcher when you need one?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Doesn't matter what time it is. It's either bad traffic, peak traffic, or slit-your-wrists traffic.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: You gotta ride the Metro-Rail, man.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: I'm sure it's ideal for carrying a ton of gold, genius.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What's your guesstimate?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: If we had all green lights, fourteen minutes. But in the twenty times I've done it, the average is thirty- two minutes, with a top time of fifty minutes.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Then we'll travel like Rockefeller.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: When cars first started catching on, workers on tall ladders would use these swiveling colored boards for traffic signals. Now whenever Rockefeller would take the drive from his mansion to his office on Wall Street, the workers would make sure that he got green boards all the way.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: How do we get all green lights?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Lyle?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Let me see what I can do.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Did you know that the first traffic signal to be patented was invented by a black man named Garrett Morgan? (to Charlie) You're not the only one who watches the History Channel.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: We still need an in to get the video blueprint.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Carpet cleaners? Gutter cleaners? Flower delivery?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: We'll never get by the guard unless they're certain it's legit. I'm thinking cable TV. We cut his cable, he calls the cable company. We show up. Send a cable technician into the house with a pinhole video camera while we get a feed through an RF antenna.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Who plays cable technician? Steve thinks we're all dead.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: If you're all dead, I guess I'm the man for the job.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Are you up for it?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: In for a penny, in for a pound.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I'm telling you. He claims he named it Napster because his hair is so nappy underneath that cap of his. But I know the real reason. It's because I was NAPPING when he stole the idea from me. I should've been on the cover of Wired magazine.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Would you clam up. You'd give a woodpecker a headache.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I'm the Napster.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Okay. You're the Napster. Heads up: cable chick.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Becky. Nice name. I wonder what she calls the other one.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: And it's such a mystery why you don't have a girlfriend.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I had a girlfriend. Unfortunately even though the relationship ceased in an objective reality, it's still going on in my mind. (tapping his head) That woman's lived in here rent-free for four years.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Okay. All we need now is a work shirt like this one and a service truck like that one. You think Stella will be able to pull it off?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: I have my doubts, but there's no talking to Charlie.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Maybe he's been inserting his hard drive into her software. Clouds the judgment.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: He knows better than to mix business with pleasure. (getting out of the car) Only I'm allowed to do that.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Where you going?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: To get a work shirt and a service truck.

Speaker: SECURITY GUARD
Content: What can I do for you, Mister Frezelli?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: The cable's out. See if you can get someone over here to fix it'.

Speaker: SECURITY GUARD
Content: Yes, sir.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Whoa. I've never heard the Muzak version of Purple Haze before.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: When's the appointment?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Thursday between 9 a.m. and 3 p.m.

Speaker: SECURITY GUARD
Content: Hello.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Yes, I'm calling from Adelphia Cable. I understand your service is out and an appointment was set up for Thursday.

Speaker: SECURITY GUARD
Content: Yes.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Well we have a technician working in your area who finished with an appointment earlier than expected. Will someone be there for the next hour?

Speaker: SECURITY GUARD
Content: Sure. That'd be great.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Our technician will see you then. Have a nice day.

Speaker: SECURITY GUARD
Content: You too.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Let's check the camera.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Stella, you're going patriotic today.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: He's got cable lines in the kitchen, living room, bedroom and a cable modem on the computer in the office. Try to get a 360 look at each room. And walk slowly or the image will streak.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I printed these up to look like paperwork from Adelphia. When you're done, ask him to sign and date the bottom.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: How you doing?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Fine. I'm fine.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You know what fine, stands for? Fucked- up, Insecure --

Speaker: STELLA & CHARLIE
Content: Neurotic and Emotional.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Here's our spot.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Girls girls girls.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Philly Steak said we'd be frisked.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: (scowls) Y'got a great job.

Speaker: BURLY MAN
Content: Pays the rent, asshole. You got a problem, talk to Skinny Pete.

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: Philly Steak sent you?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: That's right.

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: So was I right-on about the gold bricks or what?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: That's really not what I'm here to talk about. Philly Steak said you could get us some supplies.

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: What do you need?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: A four inch can of Nitramon. Nitramon primer. Detonating cord. Two triple charger chemical grenades. Launcher.

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: Nine p.m.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Should we hang here? Check out the dancers?

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: Nothing's going down here. I don't shit in my own yard, do you?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: No, but I take a whizz off the deck sometimes.

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: Five thousand dollars. And don't be late.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: It's all right. They won't bother you now.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: It's okay. I'm used to running into all sorts of dogs on my job.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: I'm Steve.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Becky.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You want to show me the problem?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Yeah. Course. This way.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I'd like to check the cable modem first.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: I'll show you.

Speaker: OFFICE
Content: She turns her body so the mini-lens can stare at the gleaming black Worthington 1000 safe. Then she goes up to his desk and pretends to work on the cable line that feeds into his computer.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: The cable guy who hooked this up weighed about 300 pounds, didn't wear any underwear, and his pants slung a little too low if you know what I mean.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: There we go. Now onto the TVs.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Is it fixed?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Turn it on and see.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Now.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Perfect.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Then it looks like you're all set.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Have we met before?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I don't think so. Sign here, please.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Date.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: You read my mind.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Oh, no. I meant that I need you to put the date by your signature. It's the 26th.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: I know what you meant. (he smiles) This might seem a little sudden, but... would you like to have dinner with me?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I don't think that'd be a very good idea.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Why? Is there some kind of cable- rule against dating customers?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: No, it's my rule. I don't accept dates from men I've just met. I've only known you five minutes.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Then I guess I'll have to sabotage my cable over and over again until you get to know me better.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Look, I'm just talking about dinner. Friday night. It's no big deal. If you don't like me, you never have to see me again. You know I'm not going to stop until you say yes.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I know it was tough in there.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: He touched my hand. And he came-on to me. That slimy, disgusting man came onto me and I had to pretend that I liked it.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You do know what this means... I've created our window of opportunity.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I know. When Steve leaves Friday night, we go in. By the time he realizes you've stood him up, we'll be long gone with the gold.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Skinny Pete.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: The guy makes Jabba the Hut look like a spokesman for the Subway Sandwiches' diet.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: What do you think?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: I'm trying not to.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Drive slow. We crash and we're a crater.

Speaker: HOMEBOY
Content: What'd you put in the trunk?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Suitcase.

Speaker: HOMEBOY
Content: Just gimme the keys before I pop a cap in your head.

Speaker: HOMEBOY
Content: Hurry up!

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Christ.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Looks like that went without a hitch.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Lyle, what's the distance from the front door to the vault?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Lyle?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: He only answers to The Napster now.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I'm not calling you The Napster.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: You call him Half-Ear.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: That wasn't my idea.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: And him, Handsome Rob.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: That's only cause he is Handsome Rob.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: And I'm The Napster.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: How far? (sighs, gives in) The Napster.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Five hundred yards.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: So here's the riddle. How do we get over a ton of gold from the vault to the getaway car?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: How wide is the hallway?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Only six feet.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Jack Daniels, straight up.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Minis?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: We could rumble right up the front steps, bring the getaway car right to the vault, and then straight to Union Station.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: We'll need three to hold the gold.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: I'd say you're a Maserati 250 S. Just 4 cylinders but can go 0 to 60 in 4.2.

Speaker: COUNTER BABE
Content: As long as it's a convertible -- I always like to have my top down.

Speaker: COUNTER BABE
Content: Do you know them?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Never seen 'em before in my life.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: You're early.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: And I'm in a hurry, okay?

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Of course the Florida vote rigging was a CIA and Mob operation.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: (with total disinterest) That a fact?

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: You want facts? Fact: CIA officials were allowed free -- and illegal -- access to official election material.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Now given the sordid history in Miami of joint ventures between Central Intelligence and the Mob, which led to the unsuccessful attempts to kill Fidel Castro and the successful assassination of your President John F. Kennedy, this conjunction raises numerous red flags.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: And I'd love to hear more about it, but like I said...

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Don't worry, we'll have you out in no time. The cash is on its way.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: On its way?

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: My cousin is bringing it over.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Your cousin?

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Yes. Cousin Mashkov.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: He's on his way?

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Don't worry, he will be here any minute.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: The tape's off?

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Of course. Believe me, he doesn't want to be on video, either.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Yevhen. Didn't I tell you, many times, that I never wanted to meet with anyone but you?

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: I know. But it's his cash. He uses me to launder money. I'm just a middleman.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: And a middleman is supposed to stay in the middle.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: But you were early. Please. Don't worry. It will be fine. My cousin's a cool guy. Like I am.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: What you are, is a Dixie cup.

Speaker: YEVHEN
Content: Dixie cup?

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: My cousin Yevhen was beaten to death.

Speaker: DANYA
Content: By who?

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: That's what I'm going to find out.

Speaker: DANYA
Content: And what will you do when you find this piece of shit who killed your cousin?

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: I'll hack off his limbs and bury him while he's still alive.

Speaker: DANYA
Content: Okay. But now we should stop talking Ukrainian, it's rude to my girl. (switching to accented ENGLISH) How are you tonight, Karen?

Speaker: KAREN
Content: Hungry.

Speaker: DANYA
Content: Then eat your Frosted Flakes.

Speaker: KAREN
Content: (like Tony the Tiger) They're grrrreat!

Speaker: DANYA
Content: Such a perfect girl.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: How are our matchbox cars?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Souped.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Don't let their size fool you. These were rally cars back in the day. 135 mph, 155 horsepower --

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Do I get to drive one?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: No.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Why not?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Because you can't navigate your way out of a parking lot. Here's your ride.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: But he ran into me.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: He's not driving either. (to Stella) You ever got a speeding ticket?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Let's put it this way: I can only get insurance through companies that advertise on TV at 3:00 in the morning.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: You drive. I drive. Charlie drives.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I got us spots for three cars on a car carrier and five first class seats. Train 59 from Union Station to New Orleans.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: That's N'Or'lins, Yankee.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What's the word on Rockefeller?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: The Traffic Control Center is on the top floor of a building on Olympic and Grand. They get their data from pavement loop detectors and video image vehicle detectors. That info is fused together by specially designed algorithms to predict traffic conditions and control the traffic lights. So all I have to do now is change the data by creating my own algorithm.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What can I do to help?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I need to hard-wire into the mainframes.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: B4 X TTratio, where Bi are Fisher's linear discriminant function coefficients, SpdRat is the speed ratio, and TTratio is the travel time ratio.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I have no idea what you're doing. Just do it fast.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: We own this place.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: $2000. And this is the new girl. Fresh off the bus. One of Danya's guys picked her up hitchhiking downtown.

Speaker: DETECTIVE
Content: Those tits'd make Dracula rise from his coffin at high-noon.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: They're all yours Saturday. You can do whatever you want to her. Her name is Karen...

Speaker: DETECTIVE
Content: You're too generous.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: I needed a fast answer.

Speaker: DETECTIVE
Content: And I'm the Shell Answer Man. A guy who works the counter at your cousin's shop told me that someone named Skinny Pete had been asking around about gold bricks with the face of a Balinese girl on them. Same gold bricks your cousin was buying.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: You talked to this Skinny Pete?

Speaker: DETECTIVE
Content: I thought you'd want a shot at him first.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You want the safe cracked, don't you?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Yeah.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Then I have to have perfect nails.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Are you making this shit up?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I just let you in on a valuable trade secret.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Charlie.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Yeah?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Steve called to confirm a 7:30 reservation at Ago's. And as for your getaway, not even Rockefeller had it so good.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Radio check.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Got cha, boss.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Loud and clear.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Check.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: For those about to rock, we salute you.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: This is it, guys. Moment of truth.

Speaker: VALET
Content: Are you hear for the Baxter party, sir?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Shit. Stella?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I know. I've got a date tonight.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You'll have to fake it. Laugh at his jokes. You need him to ask you out again.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You really make laugh.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: So here's what I have lined up for after dinner. We'll go to Club Deep. The Ferrari always gets me to the front of the line. We'll do a little dancing...

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Not tonight. I don't want to be out late.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Why the curfew?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Let's just say I've made some wrong calls in the past. I like to take things slow, cautious. Next time...

Speaker: STEVE
Content: I understand. You have nothing to worry about. You can trust me.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I trust everyone. It's the devil inside them that I don't trust.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: That's an interesting saying.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: What?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: There's only person I've ever heard say that. Used to say it all the time.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Who was that?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: A man named John Bridger. Where did you pick up that phrase?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Ow. I don't remember. You're hurting me.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: John Bridger was a thief. And he had a daughter. About your age. He told me that she took over a safe and lock company that he used as a front.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Let go of my wrist. What is wrong with you? It's just a saying.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: No wonder I liked you right away. Just like I liked your old man, right up until the moment I shot him in the head. Now tell me who you're working with and tell me the plan. Do it now or we'll go for a ride and I'll break every bone in your body.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Something wrong, Steve? You look like you want to call Ghostbusters.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: She's coming with us. You got a problem with that?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Fine by me. But it's you that has the problem.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: How do you figure?

Speaker: STEVE
Content: You've just blown the one thing you had going in your favor, the element of surprise. And I was surprised. (he laughs unpleasantly) Jesus Christ when I saw all you guys come out of the woodwork. For a minute I thought maybe you were ghosts. But you're screwed now. (an arrogant sneer a Half-Ear) Did you figure out how to take care of my security guard? I'll hire five more. (at Lyle) You know how to bypass my alarm system? I'll have a new one installed tomorrow. (at Handsome Rob) Does it tear you up inside seeing what car I drive? I'll buy a matching one in red. (at Stella) You think you can crack my safe? You'll end up the same way as your dad. (then to Charlie, all smiles) Looks like Good Time Charlie's got the blues.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You can wear that shit-eating grin on your face, but I know under that Versace shirt you're in a cold sweat. And you're not going to sleep a minute tonight. Cause you thought you'd gotten away with it free and clear. You thought you'd gotten rid of us. You're the one who's screwed. Right to the wall.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Give it your best shot. I'll outsmart you every step of the way. And this time, I'll bury you myself.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: (taking the challenge) Get more guards. Change the alarm. Buy a dozen Ferraris. We'll still be here. Sleep tight.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: (in accented English) Do you know who I am?

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: You work for Danya.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: Yes. And you are gonna be straight with me and everything's gonna be okay. You fuck with me, I will be ruthless.

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: I understand.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: I don't want you to understand. I want you to overstand.

Speaker: SKINNY PETE
Content: Overstand... Okay.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: Because if you don't overstand, I will use this.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: Someone was asking about gold bars with a Balinese girl's face on them. I want the name of this man.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Well we scared him alright. He's flying the coop. His security guard called Brink's Armored Car Service to confirm a 5 p.m. pick up at his house, then JetClub to confirm a MD11 cargo plane departing from the Imperial Terminal at LAX at 8 p.m.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Confirmed? How'd we miss the first calls?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: They must have been cellular. The cargo plane is being chartered to Mexico City.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Only place with worse smog and traffic than L.A.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Once the charter's in the air, he could change the flight path to anywhere. And good-bye gold.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Not so fast. This is good news for us.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Good news?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Sometimes when you're up to your ass in alligators you forget that you started off trying to drain the swamp.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Meaning what the fuck?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: We've been trying to get to the gold in the safe. Now the safe is coming to us. We'll boost it in transit.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Charlie. He could take a dozen different routes to the airport and we have no idea which one. We can't take out an armored truck during rush hour.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: We're already set to do it. Napster: how would you like to create the biggest traffic jam in the history of Los Angeles?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Keep talking.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You gridlock every route except the one we choose. Force the truck to go exactly where we want it to go.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: But where do we want it? We can't shoot it out with armed guards in a Brink's. We'd lose. And even if we pulled it off, the cops would be all over us, chasing us all the way to Union Station. We're outmanned and outgunned.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: But not outsmarted.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: We'll do it like the Italian job. We'll make thirty million in gold drop out of sight.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Who else has this number?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: No one but us.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Hello?

Speaker: PHILLY STEAK
Content: Why'd you do it?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: (informing the crew) Philly Steak. (then into phone) Do what?

Speaker: PHILLY STEAK
Content: Yevhen. The Ukrainian gold, dealer. You didn't, have to clip him, for Christ's sakes.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Clip him?

Speaker: PHILLY STEAK
Content: Listen to me. You've gotta get out of L.A. Now.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What're you talking about? We didn't clip anybody.

Speaker: PHILLY STEAK
Content: Well Skinny Pete just called me. Yevhen's cousin is under the distinct impression that you did.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Why does he think that?

Speaker: PHILLY STEAK
Content: Because you wanted, to know about the gold with the Balinese Girl. Plus I guess Pete was under duress. This Ukrainian thinks he's Paul Fucking Bunyan.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Do you know how to get in touch with him?

Speaker: PHILLY STEAK
Content: Yeah but...

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Maybe there's a way we can play this to our advantage.

Speaker: PHILLY STEAK
Content: Are you out of your mind? Listen to me, Charlie. Get out of L.A. Now. Cause if there's one thing I know, it's that you never mess with Mother Nature, mother-in-laws, or mother- fucking Ukrainians.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: He's going to be on Train 59 for New Orleans.

Speaker: UKRAINIAN
Content: You sure your source is good?

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: I'm sure.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Did you know Einstein's 7th grade teacher told him he was a moron who'd never amount to anything? Same as mine.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Still hope for that Nobel Prize.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Not me, man. But I did get my college diploma.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: No shit. I thought you dropped out of high school.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Got my GED after Italy then just kept going.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: How'd you manage that, all the jobs we've been pulling?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Quit going to strip clubs. Went to night school instead. City college is all.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Good for you. That's a real feather in your cap.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: I didn't want to say anything to the guys.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Secret's safe with me.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Napster. How goes it up there? Over.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Working on the Metro Rail system. Almost ready.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Everything's quiet here. Over.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You okay?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Ah huh. Just need a moment's meditation.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Now?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: I'm about to insert a wire into a detonator tube and if the wire touches the sides of tube, we'll be blown to Kingdom Come. Best to be at one with yourself.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Take all the time you need.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: My work here is done.

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Problemo.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: What is it?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: He's brought in three identical armored trucks.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Shit. Decoys. It's like a shell game on wheels.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: How can I reroute the truck if I don't know which truck to reroute?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Three Brink's trucks are leaving with motorcycle escorts, plus Steve in his Ferrari.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: How're we going to figure out which truck has the gold?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You can monitor the traffic video cameras from your laptop, right?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Yeah.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Where's the first camera the trucks will go past?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Cahuenga Boulevard. They all have to cross that.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: The weight of the gold will lower the suspension on the truck.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Lines up with the top of the sign. Next...

Speaker: LYLE
Content: First two are the same.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: That's our truck! License plate AWP82092.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Gridlock time.

Speaker: YOU'LL NEVER SHUT DOWN THE REAL NAPSTER!
CHRISTINA GRIEGO
Content: This is Christina Griego with your drive-home traffic report on KNX. I'm looking down on Hollywood Boulevard and this is definitely a CIG alert.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: What the hell?

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Opening up a space on North Highland.

Speaker: GUARD
Content: Get us out of here.

Speaker: DRIVER
Content: I'm trying.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: He's taking it...

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I now command you to turn left.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: I've got it on Hollywood Boulevard. Time to slow down.

Speaker: CHRISTINA GRIEGO
Content: According to the police, the computers at the Traffic Control Center are down.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Sonovabitch.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Gentlemen, start your engines.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Give us the flag when you're ready.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Shutting down the rail as we speak.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Tunnel's clear. Go!

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Coming into position...

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Five... Four...

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Three...

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Two... One...

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Do it.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Nice work.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Well like Einstein almost said: genius is ten percent inspiration, ninety percent detonation.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Let's get our gold.

Speaker: CHRISTINA GRIEGO
Content: I've seen earthquakes, mudslides, fires, riots, but this... Let me try to paint a picture for our listeners.

Speaker: CHRISTINA GRIEGO
Content: There's been some kind of an explosion and a Brink's truck has just dropped down into the Metro Rail Blue Line.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: The truck's in the Metro Rail. Where does the Blue Line go back above ground?

Speaker: MOTORCYCLE GUARD
Content: It comes out at Flower & Pico.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Stella?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Shhh...

Speaker: STELLA
Content: You know when you said this wouldn't be the same as opening a safe for the cops?

Speaker: HANDSOME ROB
Content: Yeah.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Did you have to be right?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Don't you want to see what's inside?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: I never look.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Trust me. You wanna look.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Split up!

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: If you don't like how I'm driving, get off the damn sidewalk.

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: What are you doing?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: What -- are -- you -- doing?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: Go that way!

Speaker: FURIOUS DRIVER
Content: What's wrong with you, you stupid- ass, son of a bitch, dickhead...

Speaker: FURIOUS DRIVER
Content: What? You want a piece of me? C'mon, dumbshit. Bring it on. I'll be pulling peanuts out of your asshole --

Speaker: FURIOUS DRIVER
Content: Shit! Shit! You shot me in the foot!

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Where are you going?

Speaker: KAREN
Content: Away.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: How about far, far away?

Speaker: KAREN
Content: The farther the better.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Going up?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: I want to make a toast. Cause there's somebody missing here today, and we all know who it is.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: To John Bridger. The most brilliant master planner of them all. We wish he was with us.

Speaker: ALL OF THEM
Content: To John.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: Take out your gun and drop it on the floor.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Who are you?

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: You knew my cousin. Yevhen.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: I never knew anyone named Yevhen.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: Get in the trunk. Not that trunk, this one. That gold is for us. A gift from some old friends of yours. They said to tell you that they didn't mind sharing the box of Cracker Jack, as long as you didn't get any. Not even the toy surprise.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Please. Don't shoot me. Please...

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: Don't worry. That wasn't the deal. I'm not going to shoot you.

Speaker: STEVE
Content: Thank you. Thank God.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: (to the others) He really thought I was going to shoot him.

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: No. No. I'm not going to shoot you. I'm going to hack off your limbs and bury you while you're still alive.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: New IDs.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: (re: his fake license) Simon Quackenbush? Could I -- just once -- have a cool name?

Speaker: HALF-EAR
Content: (also complaining) 250_pounds?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Did you get what you wanted?

Speaker: MASHKOV
Content: I'm happy.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: It was good doing business with you.

Speaker: LYLE
Content: Is this seat taken?

Speaker: KAREN
Content: It is now.

Speaker: WILL THE REAL NAPSTER PLEASE STAND UP
"HE WAS ONE OF M'S BEST STUDENTS"
CHARLIE
Content: We did it.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: We sure did.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: There's something I've been meaning to ask you, Stella. But I've just been so busy lately, what with the explosion, car chase, Ukrainians and all.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: It has been a hectic day.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: It's about that thing you said to me back in Philadelphia.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: That thing?

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: You said that you can't have a relationship with a pickpocket, gold robber, or any kind of thief.

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Oh... That thing.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Do you still believe that?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Yeah. I do.

Speaker: CHARLIE
Content: Well I was wondering... What about a retired pickpocket, gold robber, thief?

Speaker: STELLA
Content: Now that's an entirely different question.
